title: CatchAll route next-intl: no default component was found

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue was opened via the bug report template.

body:
### Link to the code that reproduces this issue

https://github.com/amannn/next-intl/tree/main/examples/example-app-router

### To Reproduce

1. start the application with next dev
2. open the console
3. go to a non existing locale route to trigger the catch all not found page.
4. see the warning concerning parallel routes in the console, even though no parallel routes are used

### Current vs. Expected behavior

Currently a warning is shown stating: 
`No default component was found for a parallel route rendered on this page. Falling back to nearest NotFound boundary.`
This warning only appears in dev mode, so not a huge issue. 

Expected behavior would either be no warning message, since no parallel routes are being used; or a warning explaining what exactly the problem is, as it doesn't have to do with parallel routes. Maybe it's just the wording, that's off.

### Provide environment information

```bash
Node.js v23.5.0

Operating System:
  Platform: darwin
  Arch: arm64
  Version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.2.0: Fri Dec  6 19:02:41 PST 2024; root:xnu-11215.61.5~2/RELEASE_ARM64_T6030
  Available memory (MB): 36864
  Available CPU cores: 12
Binaries:
  Node: 23.5.0
  npm: 10.9.2
  Yarn: N/A
  pnpm: 9.4.0
Relevant Packages:
  next: 14.2.22 // An outdated version detected (latest is 15.1.4), upgrade is highly recommended!
  eslint-config-next: 14.2.22
  react: 18.3.1
  react-dom: 18.3.1
  typescript: 5.7.2
Next.js Config:
  output: N/A
```


### Which area(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

Developer Experience, Internationalization (i18n)

### Which stage(s) are affected? (Select all that apply)

next dev (local)

### Additional context

See issue from next-intl: 
https://github.com/amannn/next-intl/issues/1179
